column1: S115B.CARD.  1. CARD ONE
S115B.DECK.  115. SURVEY NUMBER
S115B.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.

S115B.Q1. WHAT IS YOUR ARMY RANK OR GRADE?  1. PRIVATE 2. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS 3. TECHNICIAN 5TH GRADE OR CORPORAL 4. TECHNICIAN 4TH GRADE OR SERGEANT 5. TECHNICIAN 3RD GRADE OR STAFF SERGEANT 6. TECHNICAL SERGEANT 7. MASTER SERGEANT OR FIRST SERGEANT 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q2. HOW OLD WERE YOU ON YOUR LAST BIRTHDAY?  01. 18 YEARS OR LESS 02. 19 03. 20 04. 21 05. 22 06. 23 07. 24 08. 25 09. 26-29 YEARS 10. 30-34 YEARS 11. 35 YEARS OR MORE 00. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q3. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOOL?  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE

S115B.Q4. IN WHAT STATE OF THE UNITED STATES DID YOU SPEND MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY? E. SECTION:  01. NEW ENGLAND 02. MIDDLE ATLANTIC 03. EAST NORTH CENTRAL 04. WEST NORTH CENTRAL 05. SOUTH ATLANTIC 06. EAST SOUTH CENTRAL 07. WEST SOUTH CENTRAL 08. MOUNTAIN 09. PACIFIC 10. FOREIGN - U.S. POSSESSION 11. FOREIGN - NOT U.S. 12. U.S. - STATE NOT SPECIFIED 00. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q5. WHERE WERE YOU LIVING MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY?  1. ON A FARM OR IN THE COUNTRY 2. IN A SMALL TOWN (FEWER THAN 2,500 PEOPLE) 3. IN A TOWN (WITH BETWEEN 2,500 AND 25,000 PEOPLE) 4. IN A CITY (BETWEEN 25,000 AND 100,000 PEOPLE) 5. IN A LARGE CITY (MORE THAN 100,000 PEOPLE) 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q6. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE 2. MARRIED 3. DIVORCED OR SEPARATED 4. WIDOWED

S115B.Q7. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN NOW?  01. ENGINEERS 02. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. SIGNAL CORPS 07. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 08. AIR CORPS 09. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 10. MILITARY POLICE 11. OTHER

S115B.Q8. IF YOU HAD A CHOICE, WHICH ONE OF THESE BRANCHES OF THE ARMY WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE IN?  01. ENGINEERS 02. CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 03. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 04. INFANTRY 05. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 06. SIGNAL CORPS 07. COAST ARTILLERY AND ANTI-AIRCRAFT 08. AIR CORPS 09. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 10. MILITARY POLICE 11. OTHER 00. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q9. HOW DID YOU COME INTO THE ARMY?  1. I WAS DRAFTED, BEFORE PEARL HARBOR 2. I WAS DRAFTED, AFTER PEARL HARBOR 3. I VOLUNTEERED, BEFORE PEARL HARBOR 4. I VOLUNTEERED, AFTER PEARL HARBOR 5. I CAME IN THROUGH THE NATIONAL GUARD

S115B.Q10. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE ARMY? P. IF YOU HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY BEFORE, THEN WERE OUT FOR A WHILE, JUST CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOU ENTERED THIS LAST TIME. IF YOU WERE IN THE NATIONAL GUARD, CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOUR OUTFIT CAME INTO THE ARMY.  1. 9 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO 12 MONTHS 3. OVER 12 MONTHS UP TO 15 MONTHS 4. OVER 15 MONTHS UP TO 18 MONTHS 5. OVER 18 MONTHS UP TO 24 MONTHS 6. OVER 24 MONTHS UP TO 30 MONTHS 7. OVER 30 MONTHS UP TO 36 MONTHS 8. OVER 36 MONTHS UP TO 42 MONTHS 9. OVER 42 MONTHS UP TO 48 MONTHS 0. OVER 48 MONTHS

S115B.Q11. HOW MANY MONTHS HAVE YOU BEEN STATIONED IN THE CARIBBEAN AREA (COVERING PANAMA CANAL DEPARTMENT, AND ANTILLES DEPARTMENT - WHICH INCLUDES THE PUERTO RICAN DEPARTMENT, AND TRINIDAD SECTOR AND BASE COMMAND)*  ANP (MONTHS) 01. ONE MONTH OR LESS . . . 99. 99 MONTHS 00. NO ANSWER 98.NO CODE OR NO DATA
S115B.Q12. ARE YOU NOW STATIONED AT A POST OR OUTLYING POSITION?  1. POST 2. OUTLYING POSITION 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.V12A. EXPLANATION OF POST:  1. TRUE POST 2. IN BETWEEN POST AND OUTPOST - MORE LIKE POST 3. IN BETWEEN POST AND OUTPOST - MORE LIKE OUTPOST 4. TRUE OUTPOST

S115B.Q13. HOW MANY MONTHS IN ALL HAVE YOU BEEN AT YOUR PRESENT POST OR POSITION WHERE YOU ARE NOW STATIONED? (LEAVE OUT THE MONTHS YOU MAY HAVE BEEN STATIONED AWAY FROM YOUR POST OR POSITION.)  ANP (MONTHS) 01. ONE MONTH OR LESS . . . 49. OVER 49 MONTHS 00. NO ANSWER 99.NO CODE OR NO DATA

S115B.Q14. IF EVERY MAN WERE GIVEN A 30-DAY FURLOUGH TO THE STATES ONCE A YEAR, HOW LONG, IN YOUR OPINION, COULD A MAN STAY IN THE TROPICS AND STILL DO HIS JOB WELL?  1. NO MORE THAN 6 MONTHS 2. NO MORE THAN 1 YEAR 3. NO MORE THAN 1 1/2 YEARS 4. NO MORE THAN 2 YEARS 5. NO MORE THAN 2 1/2 YEARS 6. NO MORE THAN 3 YEARS 7. NO MORE THAN 3 1/2 YEARS 8. NO MORE THAN 4 YEARS 9. MORE THAN 4 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q15. WOULD YOU LIKE IT BETTER OR WORSE IF YOUR OUTFIT MOVED AROUND EVERY SIX MONTHS OR SO, TO SOME OTHER PLACE WITHIN THIS TROPICAL AREA?  1. I WOULD LIKE IT BETTER IF MY OUTFIT MOVED AROUND 2. I WOULD LIKE IT WORSE IF MY OUTFIT MOVED AROUND 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 16A AND 16B NOT CODED.
S115B.Q17. HOW INTERESTED ARE YOU IN YOUR ARMY JOB?  1. VERY MUCH INTERESTED 2. A LITTLE BUT NOT MUCH 3. NOT INTERESTED AT ALL 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q18. WOULD YOU CHANGE TO SOME OTHER ARMY JOB IF GIVEN A CHANCE?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q19. CONSIDERING EVERYTHING, DO YOU THINK THE ARMY DOES ALL IT CAN TO PROVIDE INTERESTING THINGS FOR YOU TO DO IN YOUR OFF-DUTY TIME?  1. YES, IT DOES ALL IT CAN 2. DOES QUITE A BIT, BUT COULD DO MORE 3. DOESN'T DO NEARLY ENOUGH, COULD DO A LOT MORE 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q20. IN GENERAL, WHAT SORT OF A TIME DO YOU HAVE IN THE ARMY?  1. I HAVE A PRETTY GOOD TIME 2. IT'S ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY 3. I HAVE A PRETTY ROTTEN TIME 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q21. DO YOU USUALLY FEEL THAT WHAT YOU ARE DOING IN THE ARMY IS WORTHWHILE OR NOT?  1. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS NOT WORTHWHILE 2. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS WORTHWHILE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q22. ON THE WHOLE, DO YOU THINK THE ARMY IS GIVING YOU A CHANCE TO SHOW WHAT YOU CAN DO?  1. A VERY GOOD CHANCE 2. A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE 3. NOT MUCH OF A CHANCE 4. NO CHANCE AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q23. WOULD YOU SAY THAT MOST OF THE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT USUALLY PUT ALL THEY HAVE INTO THEIR ARMY DUTIES, OR DO THEY USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY?  1. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY PUT ALL THEY HAVE INTO IT 2. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY WORK HARD BUT COULD DO MORE 3. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q24. HOW ABOUT YOU, YOURSELF - WOULD YOU HONESTLY SAY THAT YOU USUALLY PUT ALL YOU HAVE INTO YOUR ARMY DUTIES, OR DO YOU USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY?  1. I USUALLY PUT ALL I HAVE INTO IT 2. I USUALLY WORK HARD BUT COULD DO MORE 3. I USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q25. IN GENERAL, HOW WOULD YOU SAY YOU FEEL MOST OF THE TIME, IN GOOD SPIRITS OR IN LOW SPIRITS?  1. I AM USUALLY IN GOOD SPIRITS 2. I AM IN GOOD SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME AND IN LOW SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME 3. I AM USUALLY IN LOW SPIRITS 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q26. IF IT WERE UP TO YOU TO CHOOSE, DO YOU THINK YOU COULD DO MORE FOR YOUR COUNTRY AS A SOLDIER OR AS A WORKER IN A WAR JOB?  1. AS A SOLDIER 2. AS A WAR WORKER 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q27. SINCE YOU HAVE BEEN IN THIS AREA, HAVE YOU EVER HAD A FURLOUGH OF ANY KIND? (INCLUDE REGULAR, EMERGENCY, LOCAL FURLOUGHS, AND FURLOUGHS TO THE U.S.)  1. NO, I HAVE NEVER HAD A FURLOUGH OF ANY KIND FROM HERE 2. YES, I HAVE HAD A REGULAR FURLOUGH TO THE UNITED STATES 3. YES, I HAVE HAD AN EMERGENCY FURLOUGH TO THE UNITED STATES 4. YES, I HAVE HAD A LOCAL FURLOUGH 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q28. UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES, WHAT DO YOU THINK ABOUT THE WAY FURLOUGHS HAVE BEEN HANDLED IN THIS AREA?  1. HANDLED AS WELL AS POSSIBLE, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 2. HANDLED PRETTY WELL, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 3. HANDLED PRETTY BADLY, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 4. HANDLED VERY BADLY, UNDER THE CIRCUMSTANCES 0. DON'T KNOW, NO ANSWER

S115B.Q29. IN CASE YOU NEEDED AN EMERGENCY FURLOUGH, WHAT DO YOU THINK YOUR CHANCES WOULD BE OF GETTING ONE, IF IT HAD ALREADY BEEN LOOKED INTO AND APPROVED BY THE RED CROSS?  1. ODDS WOULD BE VERY HIGH THAT I WOULD GET ONE 2. ODDS WOULD BE FAIRLY HIGH THAT I WOULD GET ONE 3. ODDS WOULD BE FIFTY-FIFTY THAT I WOULD GET ONE 4. ODDS WOULD BE FAIRLY LOW THAT I WOULD GET ONE 5. ODDS WOULD BE VERY LOW THAT I WOULD GET ONE 6. HAVE NO IDEA WHAT MY CHANCES WOULD BE 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q30. ACCORDING TO THE PRESENT POLICY, HOW MANY MONTHS DOES A MAN HAVE TO SPEND IN THIS AREA BEFORE HE CAN BE REASSIGNED?  01. 24 MONTHS; "24 MONTHS OR MORE"; "OVER 24 MONTHS" 02. 18 MONTHS; "18 MONTHS OR MORE"; "OVER 18 MONTHS" 03. LESS THAN 6 MONTHS 04. 6 MONTHS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 12 MONTHS 05. 12 MONTHS UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 18 MONTHS 06. OVER 18 MONTHS, UP TO BUT NOT INCLUDING 24 MONTHS 07. OVER 24 MONTHS - A NUMBER OVER 24 IS STATED - E.G. 26 MONTHS 08. DEPENDS ON OUTFIT, NO LIMITS, WHEN WAR DEPARTMENT SEES FIT 09. DON'T KNOW 10. 18 TO 24 MONTHS (THESE TWO FIGURES SPECIFICALLY NAMED) 00. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q31. IF YOU WERE SENT HOME ON FURLOUGH AND THEN GIVEN YOUR CHOICE OF ASKING FOR REASSIGNMENT OR COMING BACK HERE FOR ANOTHER 6 MONTHS, WHICH WOULD YOU DO?  1. I WOULD COME BACK HERE FOR ANOTHER 6 MONTHS 2. I WOULD ASK FOR REASSIGNMENT 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q32. WHEN YOU HAVE PUT IN THE AMOUNT OF TIME REQUIRED BY THE ARMY FOR REASSIGNMENT, DO YOU THINK THAT THE ARMY WILL OR WILL NOT KEEP ITS PROMISE TO SEND YOU BACK TO THE UNITED STATES FOR REASSIGNMENT?  1. I AM SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 2. I AM FAIRLY SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 3. I AM NOT VERY SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 4. I AM NOT AT ALL SURE THAT WHEN MY TIME IS UP, I WILL BE SENT BACK 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q33. ARE YOU IN BETTER OR WORSE PHYSICAL CONDITION NOW THAN YOU WERE WHEN YOU FIRST CAME INTO THIS AREA?  1. IN BETTER CONDITION THAN WHEN I FIRST CAME TO THIS AREA 2. IN ABOUT THE SAME CONDITION AS WHEN I FIRST CAME TO THIS AREA 3. IN WORSE CONDITION THAN WHEN I FIRST CAME TO THIS AREA 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 34 NOT CODED.

S115B.Q35. DO YOU THINK THE EQUIPMENT OF THE AMERICAN ARMY IS BETTER OR WORSE THAN THE EQUIPMENT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY?  1. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 2. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 3. OUR EQUIPMENT IS ABOUT THE SAME AS THAT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY 4. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 5. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 6. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q36. WHICH COMES CLOSEST TO YOUR IDEA OF HOW HARD IT IS GOING TO BE TO BEAT THE JAPANESE?  1. IT WILL NOT BE VERY HARD 2. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, BUT OUR LOSSES WON'T BE TOO HEAVY 3. IT WILL BE A TOUGH JOB, WITH HEAVY LOSSES OF MEN AND EQUIPMENT 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q37. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY OF THIS AREA BEING ATTACKED BY GERMANY OR BY JAPAN BEFORE THE END OF THE WAR?  1. IT'S ALMOST CERTAIN TO BE ATTACKED 2. IT'S VERY LIKELY TO BE ATTACKED 3. IT'S NOT LIKELY BUT POSSIBLE THAT IT WILL BE ATTACKED 4. IT'S NOT AT ALL LIKELY TO BE ATTACKED 5. IT'S ALMOST CERTAIN NOT TO BE ATTACKED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q38. IF YOU THINK THE ENEMY MIGHT ATTACK THIS AREA, WHAT KIND OF ATTACK DO YOU THINK WOULD BE MOST LIKELY?  1. A FULL SCALE LANDING INVASION 2. A FAIRLY LARGE SEA AND AIR ATTACK 3. A "HIT-AND RUN" OR "COMMANDO" TYPE OF ATTACK 4. SABOTAGE - FOR EXAMPLE, ATTEMPTS BY ENEMY AGENTS TO DESTROY THE PANAMA CANAL 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q39. FROM WHAT YOU HAVE SEEN OF OUR FIGHTING EQUIPMENT IN YOUR AREA, HOW DO YOU THINK IT WOULD DO AGAINST AN ENEMY ATTACK?  1. IT WOULD DO VERY WELL AGAINST AN ATTACK 2. IT WOULD DO FAIRLY WELL AGAINST AN ATTACK 3. IT WOULD NOT DO TOO WELL AGAINST AN ATTACK 4. IT WOULD NOT DO WELL AT ALL AGAINST AN ATTACK 5. HAVE NO IDEA 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 40 NOT CODED.

S115B.Q41. IN GENERAL, DO YOU THINK CIVILIANS BACK HOME IN THE UNITED STATES ARE TRYING TO DO EVERYTHING THEY POSSIBLY CAN TO BACK UP THE ARMED FORCES?  1. MOST OF THEM ARE 2. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 3. MOST OF THEM ARE NOT 4. NO OPINION 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 42 AND 43 NOT CODED.

S115B.Q44. DO YOU EVER WORRY ABOUT HOW WELL YOUR FAMILY IS GETTING ALONG BACK HOME?  1. I DON'T WORRY AT ALL ABOUT HOW THEY ARE GETTING ALONG 2. I WORRY A LITTLE BUT NOT MUCH ABOUT HOW THEY ARE GETTING ALONG 3. I WORRY PRETTY MUCH ABOUT HOW THEY ARE GETTING ALONG 4. I WORRY A LOT ABOUT HOW THEY ARE GETTING ALONG 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q45. UP TO NOW HAS THE WAR MADE THINGS BETTER OR WORSE FINANCIALLY FOR YOUR FAMILY BACK HOME?  1. THINGS ARE A LOT BETTER FOR THEM FINANCIALLY 2. THINGS ARE A LITTLE BETTER, BUT NOT MUCH 3. I DON'T SEE ANY DIFFERENCE 4. THINGS ARE A LITTLE WORSE 5. THINGS ARE A LOT WORSE 6. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q46. HOW ARE THE SOLDIERS IN YOUR AREA USUALLY TREATED BY CIVILIANS?  1. THEY ARE USUALLY TREATED VERY WELL 2. THEY ARE USUALLY TREATED PRETTY WELL 3. THEY ARE USUALLY TREATED PRETTY POORLY 4. THEY ARE USUALLY TREATED VERY POORLY 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q47A. IF YOU HAD YOUR CHOICE, WHAT KIND OF AN OUTFIT WOULD YOU RATHER BE IN?  1. IN A COMBAT OUTFIT (FIGHTING OUTFIT) 2. IN A NON-COMBAT OUTFIT 3. UNDECIDED, DOESN'T MATTER 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q47B. WHERE WOULD YOU LIKE THIS OUTFIT YOU JUST CHOSE, TO SERVE?  1. IN THE UNITED STATES 2. OVERSEAS IN A ZONE WHERE THERE IS NO FIGHTING 3. IN A FIGHTING ZONE 4. UNDECIDED, DOESN'T MATTER 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q48. CONSIDERING THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES, HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE PRIVILEGES AND BREAKS THAT OFFICERS WHERE YOU ARE STATIONED GET?  1. OFFICERS GET FAR TOO MANY PRIVILEGES AND BREAKS 2. OFFICERS GET A FEW TOO MANY PRIVILEGES AND BREAKS 3. OFFICERS GET ABOUT THE RIGHT NUMBER OF PRIVILEGES AND BREAKS 4. OFFICERS GET TOO FEW PRIVILEGES AND BREAKS 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q49. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS REALLY KNOW THEIR STUFF?  1. ALL OF THEM DO 2. MOST OF THEM DO 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM DO 4. FEW OF THEM DO 5. NONE OF THEM DO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q50. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS TAKE A PERSONAL INTEREST IN THEIR MEN?  1. ALL OF THEM DO 2. MOST OF THEM DO 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM DO 4. FEW OF THEM DO 5. NONE OF THEM DO 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q51. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS ARE THE KIND WHO ARE WILLING TO GO THROUGH ANYTHING THEY ASK THEIR MEN TO GO THROUGH?  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q52. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS ARE THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT TO SERVE WITH UNDER COMBAT CONDITIONS?  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q53. WHAT DO YOU THINK OF THE NON-COMS IN YOUR OUTFIT?  1. THEY ARE BETTER THAN ANY MEN IN THE OUTFIT FOR THEIR JOB 2. THEY ARE AS GOOD AS ANY MEN IN THE OUTFIT FOR THEIR JOB 3. THEY ARE NOT AS GOOD AS SOME MEN IN THE OUTFIT FOR THEIR JOB 4. THEY ARE NOT AS GOOD AS MOST MEN IN THE OUTFIT FOR THEIR JOB 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q54. SOME NON-COMS (REASSIGNMENT NON-COMS) ARE SHIPPED DOWN FROM THE UNITED STATES RATHER THAN PICKED FROM THE OUTFITS HERE. HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THIS POLICY?  1. IT DOESN'T BOTHER ME AT ALL 2. IT GRIPES ME SOME, BUT NOT MUCH 3. IT GRIPES ME QUITE A BIT 4. IT GRIPES ME A GREAT DEAL 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q55. WHAT DO YOU THINK YOUR CHANCES ARE OF BEING SENT INTO AN ACTIVE COMBAT ZONE BEFORE THE END OF THE WAR?  1. I'M ALMOST CERTAIN TO BE SENT 2. I'M FAIRLY CERTAIN TO BE SENT 3. THE CHANCES ARE ABOUT FIFTY-FIFTY I'LL BE SENT 4. I'M FAIRLY CERTAIN NOT TO BE SENT 5. I'M ALMOST CERTAIN NOT TO BE SENT 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q56. DO YOU THINK THAT THE PUNISHMENT (COMPANY PUNISHMENT) GIVEN IN YOUR OUTFIT IS FAIR OR UNFAIR?  1. IT IS ALMOST ALWAYS FAIR 2. IT IS USUALLY FAIR 3. IT IS USUALLY NOT FAIR 4. IT IS ALMOST NEVER FAIR 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q57. DO YOU FEEL THAT MOST MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT ARE WELL ENOUGH TRAINED, OR NOT WELL ENOUGH TRAINED, TO GO INTO AN ACTIVE COMBAT ZONE IN THE NEAR FUTURE?  1. MOST MEN ARE WELL-ENOUGH TRAINED 2. MOST MEN ARE NOT WELL ENOUGH TRAINED 3. HAVE NO IDEA 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q58. CHECK THE STATEMENT BELOW WHICH IN YOUR OPINION TELLS WHAT SORT OF A RECORD A SOLDIER MUST HAVE BEFORE HE CAN GET A GOOD CONDUCT RIBBON.  1. HE MUST HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY ONE YEAR WITHOUT HAVING BEEN GIVEN COMPANY PUNISHMENT 2. HE MUST HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY ONE YEAR WITHOUT HAVING BEEN IN THE GUARDHOUSE 3. HE MUST HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY ONE YEAR WITH A CLEAN RECORD 4. HE MUST HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY ONE YEAR WITH A RECORD AS AN OUTSTANDING SOLDIER 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q59. DO YOU FEEL THAT YOU ARE ENTITLED TO RECEIVE A GOOD CONDUCT RIBBON FOR YOUR SERVICE IN THIS AREA?  1. YES, AND I ALREADY HAVE ONE 2. YES, BUT I DO NOT HAVE ONE 3. NO, I DO NOT FEEL THAT I AM ENTITLED TO ONE 4. I DON'T KNOW 5. HAVEN'T BEEN IN ARMY LONG ENOUGH TO GET ONE 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q60. ARE THE GOOD CONDUCT RIBBONS MEN RECEIVE IN YOUR OUTFIT GIVEN OUT FAIRLY OR NOT?  1. THEY ARE GIVEN OUT FAIRLY 2. THEY ARE NOT GIVEN OUT FAIRLY 3. UNDECIDED 4. NONE HAVE BEEN GIVEN OUT IN MY OUTFIT 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q61A. WHAT WEAPON ARE YOU ARMED WITH?  1. RIFLE 2. PISTOL 3. TOMMY GUN 4. CARBINE 5. BROWNING AUTOMATIC RIFLE (BAR) 6. I'M NOT SUPPOSED TO BE ARMED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q61B. WHAT IS YOUR QUALIFICATION WITH THE WEAPON YOU CHECKED ABOVE?  1. I FAILED TO QUALIFY 2. I MADE MARKSMAN 3. I MADE SHARPSHOOTER 4. I MADE EXPERT 5. I'VE NEVER FIRED MY WEAPON AT ALL 6. I'VE NEVER FIRED MY WEAPON ON A QUALIFICATION COURSE 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q62. IF YOU COULD BE GIVEN AN EXTRA HOUR OF FREE TIME EVERY DAY, ON WHICH ONE OF THE FOLLOWING THINGS DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD SPEND THE MOST OF THIS EXTRA TIME?  1. PLAYING GAMES OR SPORTS 2. WRITING LETTERS, ETC. 3. READING PAPERS, MAGAZINES, ETC. 4. SLEEPING 5. STUDYING 6. OTHER 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q63. HOW OFTEN DO YOU GO TO A U.S.O. CLUB NEAR WHERE YOU ARE NOW STATIONED?  1. I OFTEN GO 2. I SELDOM GO 3. I NEVER GO 4. THERE IS NO U.S.O. CLUB NEARBY 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 64 NOT CODED.

S115B.Q65. DO YOU THINK MOST M.P.,S IN TOWN TREAT SOLDIERS FAIRLY OR UNFAIRLY?  1. MOST M.P.,S TREAT SOLDIERS FAIRLY 2. ABOUT HALF THE M.P.,S TREAT SOLDIERS FAIRLY 3. MOST M.P.,S DO NOT TREAT SOLDIERS FAIRLY 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q66A. HAVE YOU EVER RECEIVED COMPANY PUNISHMENT IN YOUR PRESENT OUTFIT? (COMPANY PUNISHMENT IS AUTHORIZED BY THE 104TH ARTICLE OF WAR.)  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER X. COL. 80 NOT USED. CARD 2
S115B.CARD.  2. CARD TWO
S115B.DECK.  115. SURVEY NUMBER
S115B.BALLOT.  X. BALLOT NUMBER GENERATED BY ROPER CENTER.
S115B.Q66B1. DID YOUR COMMANDING OFFICER PERSONALLY NOTIFY YOU OF THE PUNISHMENT?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q66B2. DID HE, OR ANYONE ELSE, EXPLAIN YOUR RIGHTS TO APPEAL TO THE NEXT HIGHER COMMANDER?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q66B3. IN YOUR OUTFIT DOES IT SOMETIMES HAPPEN THAT MEN ARE JUST NOTIFIED OF THEIR COMPANY PUNISHMENT WITHOUT EVER HAVING HAD A HEARING?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q66B4. IN YOUR OUTFIT DOES IT SOMETIMES HAPPEN THAT MEN ARE GIVEN RESTRICTION FOR A PERIOD OF MORE THAN SEVEN DAYS AS COMPANY PUNISHMENT?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER P. BELOW ARE SOME QUESTIONS ABOUT THE ARMY'S OFF-DUTY TIME PLAN OF EDUCATION. WE WANT TO KNOW HOW MUCH, IF ANYTHING, MEN HAVE BEEN TOLD ABOUT THIS EDUCATION PLAN.
S115B.Q67. MANY ARMY CORRESPONDENCE COURSES COST ...*  1. $5.00 2. $2.00 3. NOTHING (FREE) 4. $3.50 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q68. IN ORDER TO GET CREDIT A MAN MUST COMPLETE AN ARMY CORRESPONDENCE COURSE WITHIN ...*  1. 6 MONTHS FROM WHEN THE COURSE STARTS 2. AS MUCH TIME AS IS NEEDED 3. 8 MONTHS FROM WHEN THE COURSE STARTS 4. 12 MONTHS FROM WHEN THE COURSE STARTS 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q69. MOST ARMY CORRESPONDENCE COURSES ARE OFFERED IN SUCH SUBJECTS AS ...*  1. ALGEBRA, MATHEMATICS, AND BOOKKEEPING 2. COMPANY AND PERSONNEL ADMINISTRATION 3. CARE AND MAINTENANCE OF WEAPONS AND EQUIPMENT 4. SCOUTING, PATROLLING, AND JUNGLE TACTICS 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q70. ARMY CORRESPONDENCE COURSES ARE OPEN TO ...*  1. OFFICERS AND NON-COMS ONLY 2. ENLISTED MEN WHO NEED SPECIAL TRAINING FOR THEIR JOBS 3. ENLISTED MEN WHO ARE PICKED BY THEIR COMPANY OR UNIT COMMANDERS 4. ANY ENLISTED MEN AFTER THEY HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY FOR A FEW MONTHS 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q71A. DOES YOUR OUTFIT HAVE ENOUGH ATHLETIC EQUIPMENT (BASEBALLS, BATS, HORSESHOES, ETC.)*  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q71B. DOES YOUR OUTFIT HAVE ENOUGH PLACES (FIELDS, COURTS, ETC.) TO PLAY ATHLETIC GAMES?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q72. HOW MANY HOURS EACH WEEK, ON THE AVERAGE, DO YOU LISTEN TO THE RADIO?  01. 1 HOUR 02. 2 03. 3 OR 4 04. 5 OR 6 05. 7 OR 8 06. 9 OR 10 07. 11 TO 20 08. 21 TO 30 09. 31 TO 50 10. 51 HOURS OR OVER 11. NONE 00. NO ANSWER OR DON'T KNOW

S115B.Q73. DO YOU HAVE A PERSONAL RADIO OF YOUR OWN WHERE YOU ARE STATIONED?  1. YES, AND IT IS IN WORKING ORDER 2. YES, BUT IT IS NOT IN WORKING ORDER 3. NO, I DO NOT HAVE A RADIO OF MY OWN 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q74A. HOW FAR FROM YOUR BARRACKS IS THE RADIO THAT YOU NOW LISTEN TO MOST OFTEN?  1. IT IS RIGHT IN MY BARRACKS 2. 5 MINUTE WALK OR LESS 3. OVER 5 MINUTE UP TO 10 MINUTE WALK 4. OVER 10 MINUTE WALK 5. I DON'T LISTEN TO THE RADIO 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q74B. WHO DOES THIS RADIO BELONG TO?  1. IT IS MY OWN RADIO 2. IT IS A RADIO OWNED BY ANOTHER SOLDIER IN MY BARRACKS OR LIVING QUARTERS 3. IT IS AN ARMY RADIO IN DAY ROOM, SERVICE CLUB, OR ANY OTHER RADIO SUPPLIED BY THE ARMY 4. DOESN'T LISTEN TO THE RADIO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q74C. DOES THIS RADIO OPERATE ON STANDARD OR SHORTWAVE?  1. STANDARD (LONGWAVE) 2. SHORTWAVE 3. BOTH STANDARD AND SHORTWAVE 4. DOESN'T LISTEN TO THE RADIO 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 75 NOT CODED.

S115B.Q76. HOW DO YOU USUALLY FEEL ABOUT THE ARMY FOOD YOU ARE GETTING?  1. IT IS USUALLY GOOD QUALITY, AND WELL PREPARED 2. IT IS USUALLY GOOD QUALITY, BUT POORLY PREPARED 3. IT IS USUALLY POOR QUALITY, BUT WELL PREPARED 4. IT IS USUALLY POOR QUALITY, AND POORLY PREPARED 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q77A. FOR BREAKFAST?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q77B. FOR DINNER?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q77C. FOR SUPPER?  1. YES 2. NO 0. NO ANSWER
S115B.Q78. WHEN YOUR FOOD IS SERVED IS IT USUALLY FRESH AND HOT?  1. YES 2. NO 3. SOMETIMES FRESH AND SOMETIMES HOT 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTIONS 79 AND 80 NOT CODED.

S115B.Q81. HAVE YOU EVER BEEN TO DINNER OR SUPPER IN A CIVILIAN HOME SINCE YOU HAVE BEEN WHERE YOU ARE NOW STATIONED?  1. YES, SEVERAL TIMES 2. YES, ONCE OR TWICE 3. NO, I NEVER HAVE 0. NO ANSWER P. THE "NEWSMAP" IS A LARGE POSTER PUT OUT BY THE WAR DEPARTMENT ONCE A WEEK AND POSTED IN ARMY CAMPS. IT HAS MAPS, PICTURES, AND NEWS OF THE FIGHTING FRONTS.

S115B.Q82. HAVE YOU EVER SEEN AN ARMY "NEWSMAP" WHERE YOU ARE NOW STATIONED?  1. I HAVE NEVER SEEN AN ARMY "NEWSMAP" WHERE I AM NOW STATIONED 2. I SEE THE NEW "NEWSMAP" EVERY WEEK 3. I SEE THE NEW "NEWSMAP" ONCE OR TWICE A MONTH 4. I SEE THE NEW "NEWSMAP" LESS THAN ONCE A MONTH 5. I AM NOT SURE 0. NO ANSWER P. EVERY MONTH THE WAR DEPARTMENT SENDS OUT A "HIT KIT" WHICH HAS THE WORDS OF SEVERAL POPULAR SONGS PRINTED IN IT. THERE IS A DIFFERENT SET OF SONGS EACH MONTH.
S115B.Q83. HOW OFTEN DO YOU SEE A NEW COPY OF THE "ARMY HIT KIT"*  1. I SEE A NEW ONE EVERY MONTH 2. I SEE A NEW ONE NOW AND THEN 3. I HAVE NEVER SEEN ONE 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q84A. IF EVENING STUDY CLASSES WERE HELD IN YOUR OUTFIT, IN YOUR OFF-DUTY TIME, ONE HOUR A NIGHT, TWO NIGHTS A WEEK, WITH INSTRUCTORS WHO KNEW THEIR STUFF, DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD TAKE A CLASS REGULARLY IN SOME SUBJECT FOR THE NEXT SIX MONTHS?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 84B NOT CODED.

S115B.Q85A. DO YOU KNOW OF ANY POST REGULATION, REGIMENTAL REGULATION, OR OTHER REGULATION WHICH AUTHORIZES AN ENLISTED MAN HAVING A COMPLAINT OR GRIEVANCE TO PRESENT THE MATTER DIRECTLY TO HIS REGIMENTAL OR SEPARATE BATTALION COMMANDER WITHOUT PERMISSION OF HIS ORGANIZA- TION COMMANDER IF HIS ORGANIZATION COMMANDER HAS ALREADY HEARD HIS COMPLAINT OR GRIEVANCE AND THE ENLISTED MAN IS NOT SATISFIED WITH THE DECISION?  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S115B.Q85B. IF YOU DO NOT KNOW OF ANY REGULATION LIKE THAT DESCRIBED ABOVE, DO YOU THINK IT WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA TO HAVE SUCH A POST OR REGIMENTAL REGULATION?  1. YES, SUCH A REGULATION IS A GOOD IDEA 2. NO, SUCH A REGULATION IS NOT A GOOD IDEA 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 86 NOT CODED.
